books.author: by Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.
books.name: BECOMING

books.author: by Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
books.name: EDUCATED

books.author: by Ben Shapiro
books.description: The conservative political commentator reflects upon what he considers most impactful to Western civilization.
books.name: THE RIGHT SIDE OF HISTORY

books.author: by John Carreyrou
books.description: The rise and fall of Theranos, the biotech startup that failed to deliver on its promise to make blood testing more efficient.
books.name: BAD BLOOD

books.author: by Preet Bharara
books.description: The former U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York describes some of his career highlights and gives insights into our legal system.
books.name: DOING JUSTICE

books.author: by Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.”
books.name: BORN A CRIME

books.author: by Pete Buttigieg
books.description: A memoir by the current mayor of South Bend, Ind., and the first openly gay Democratic candidate to run for president of the United States.
books.name: SHORTEST WAY HOME

books.author: by Tommy Lee, Vince Neil, Mick Mars, Nikki Sixx and Neil Strauss
books.description: The story of Mötley Crüe as told by the four original members of the band.
books.name: THE DIRT

books.author: by Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species.
books.name: SAPIENS

books.author: by Patrick Radden Keefe
books.description: A look at the conflict in Northern Ireland known as the Troubles.
books.name: SAY NOTHING

books.author: by Nicholas A. Christakis
books.description: The physician and sociologist makes his case that genes affect the ways we make societies and natural selection guides us toward creating a good society.
books.name: BLUEPRINT

books.author: by Stacey Abrams
books.description: A memoir by the former minority leader of the Georgia House of Representatives who ran to be the state’s governor in 2018.
books.name: LEAD FROM THE OUTSIDE

books.author: by Bob Klapisch and Paul Solotaroff
books.description: The 2018 season provides a backdrop to an inside look at the New York Yankees.
books.name: INSIDE THE EMPIRE

books.author: by Lynne Olson
books.description: A 31-year-old French mother led an intelligence organization that worked against Hitler and the Gestapo.
books.name: MADAME FOURCADE'S SECRET WAR

books.author: by John Grisham
books.description: Grisham's first nonfiction book concerns a man wrongly sentenced to death.
books.name: THE INNOCENT MAN
